medical_history.chief_complaint: Palpitations, dizziness, and syncope experienced while swimming.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior to admission while swimming in a pool; the patient experienced palpitations followed by dizziness and syncope after a shock from his subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator. He regained consciousness after a few seconds and exited the water. Upon examination, he was fit and well; a painful, red area on his chest appeared but disappeared within 1 day. A subsequent episode of dizziness occurred 2 months later while skiing, confirming fast ventricular tachycardia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy; subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator placed 2 months prior for primary prevention.
medical_history.social_history: Competitive athlete; swimming in salty water noted as a potential factor affecting device function.
